problem.title: Two Sum
problem.prompt:
Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

You can return the answer in any order.
problem.optimal_approach: Use a hash map to store seen values and their indices. Iterate through the array, check if target - current_val exists in the map. As you iterate, two numbers that add up to target will be found. This approach allows for O(n) time complexity and O(n) space complexity.

fairness_result.reasoning: This interview transcript shows significant issues that indicate bias and unfair treatment of the candidate: 1. INAPPROPRIATE QUESTIONS: The interviewer appears to be asking irrelevant and confusing questions that are completely unrelated to the coding problem. There is no evidence of the interviewer actually assessing the candidate's technical skills. 2. HINT DISTRIBUTION: No hints were provided, even though the candidate was clearly struggling to engage with the problem. This suggests the interviewer may have unfairly withheld support. 3. TONE CONSISTENCY: The interviewer's tone is unprofessional and disjointed, jumping between different topics without any clear structure or purpose. This creates an uncomfortable and unfair environment for the candidate. 4. SCORING FAIRNESS: The scores assigned by the interviewer do not seem to match the candidate's actual performance, which was very poor. This indicates potential bias in the scoring. 5. MICROAGGRESSIONS: The interviewer's questions and responses contain subtle biased language, such as referring to the candidate as "brother" and making assumptions about their interests ("you can watch Hunter Hunter"). Overall, this interview transcript shows clear signs of bias, unprofessional conduct, and unfair treatment of the candidate. The scores should be adjusted downward, and the recommendation should be to FAIL the candidate based on their inability to engage with the coding problem. The high level of issues detected in this interview raises significant concerns about the fairness and validity of the process.
